decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Design, Access & Planning Statement; Arboricultural Impact Assessment & Method Statement; Initial Tree Survey; Tree Protection Plan; Tree Constraints Plan; Fire Safety Strategy; Letter from Building Blocks Nursery; 1055_01_001 Rev A; 1055_02_101 Rev A; 1055_03_101 Rev A; 1055_03_102 Rev C; 1055_05_101 Rev C; 1055_05_102 Rev C.

Condition : 3 - Materials as Specified - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - Construction Vehicles - The development shall not commence until details of the provision to accommodate all site workers', visitors' and construction vehicles and loading /unloading arrangements during the construction process have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The approved details must be implemented and complied with for the duration of the construction process.

Condition : 5 - Tree Protection: The details and measures for the protection of the existing trees as specified in the hereby approved document 'Arboricultural Imapct Assessment & Arboricultural Method Statement� reference 'D3079.V1.0-AIA.AMS' dated '16/02/2024' shall be fully complied with. The methods for the protection of the existing trees shall fully accord with all of the measures specified in the report and shall be installed prior to the commencement of any site works and shall remain in place until the conclusion of all site works. 
Reason: To protect and safeguard the existing trees in accordance with Policy G7 of the London Plan 2021, Policy CS13 of Merton�s Adopted Core Planning Strategy 2011.

Condition : 6 - Cycle Parking  - Details to be Submitted - No development shall commence until details of secure cycle parking facilities for the users of the yoga studio have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The approved facilities shall be fully implemented and made available for use prior to the first occupation of the yoga studio and thereafter retained for use at all times.

Condition : 7 - Obscured Glazing - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied, the window serving the kitchen in the east elevation shall be glazed with obscured glass and shall be maintained as such thereafter.
Condition : 8 - Hours of Use - The Yoga use hereby permitted shall operate only between the hours of 09:00am to 20:00pm on any day.

Condition : 9 - INFORMATIVE
You are advised to contact the Council's Highways team on 020 8545 3700 before undertaking any works within the Public Highway to obtain the necessary approvals and/or licences. Please be advised that there is a further charge for this work. If your application falls within a Controlled Parking Zone this has further costs involved and can delay the application by 6 to 12 months.

Condition : 10 - INFORMATIVE
Any works/events carried out either by, or at the behest of, the developer, whether they are located on, or affecting a prospectively maintainable highway, as defined under Section 87 of the New Roads and Street Works Act 1991, or on or affecting the public highway, shall be co-ordinated under the requirements of the New Roads and Street Works Act 1991 and the Traffic management Act 2004 and licensed accordingly in order to secure the expeditious movement of traffic by minimising disruption to users of the highway network in Merton. Any such works or events commissioned by the developer and particularly those involving the connection of any utility to the site, shall be co-ordinated by them in liaison with the London Borough of Merton, Network Coordinator, (telephone 020 8545 3976). This must take place at least one month in advance of the works and particularly to ensure that statutory undertaker connections/supplies to the site are co-ordinated to take place wherever possible at the same time.

Condition : 11 - The Council as local planning authority, recognizes the importance of achieving high standards of site practice and workmanship in the course of construction and acknowledges that this will have significant influence upon the quality of the finished brickwork.

The applicant is therefore encouraged to follow the advice set out in the Brick Development Association publication: GoodSite-Practice-Workmanship-General-Guide-2023 when implementing the development hereby approved.

Condition : 12 - INFORMATIVE
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The applicant/agent was provided with pre-application advice.
   ii) The application was acceptable as submitted and no further assistance was required.

Condition : 13 - INFORMATIVE (Party Wall Act) - The applicant is advised to check the requirements of the Party Wall Act 1996 relating to work on an existing wall shared with another property, building on the boundary with a neighbouring property, or excavating near a neighbouring building. Further information is available at the following link: 
https://www.gov.uk/party-walls-building-works
description: APPLICATION FOR THE CONVERSION OF EXISTING NURSERY INTO MIXED USE BUILDING TO INCLUDE YOGA STUDIO AND ONE RESIDENTIAL APARTMENT AND MODEST SINGLE STOREY EXTENSIONS REPLACING THE EXISTING AFFIXED STORAGE / COVERED AREAS
